title: Teen dies, child injured in McKees Rocks drive-by shooting
content:
MCKEES ROCKS, Pa. —
A teen was killed and a child was injured Friday evening in a drive-by shooting in McKees Rocks, police said.
An 18-year-old-man was standing at the intersection of Russellwood and Valley streets when a white sedan drove by and someone inside fired shots. The man was hit several times in the head, torso and arms, Stowe Township police said.
The Allegheny County medical examiner identified the victim as Jabree Hines, of Pittsburgh.
A 7-year-old, who was in a car with her mother driving past the scene, was hit by a bullet in the thigh. Her mom drove to the Stowe Township Police Department, which is a block from the scene.
Witnesses told police they saw some men run from the scene. Police are not sure if those men are connected to the shooting.
The condition of the 7-year-old is not known.
Police have not identified any suspects.
Anyone who may have heard or seen any of the events is asked to call the Allegheny County police Homicide Unit at 412-473-1300. Callers can remain anonymous and can also reach county police through the county’s social media accounts.
